website_summaries.verdict: A powerful and full-featured entertainment tablet (particularly if you are a Prime member), but bad connectivity issues and the blocking of all-things Google hurt it some.
pros: Color options here include marine blue, punch red, and black
Comes with Alexa for handsfree use
cons: Wi-Fi connectivity here can be spotty
Many of these do not work well with Google services such as Google Docs

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is the best 149 dollars, I've ever spent!
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is awesome! it is really fast and it is really smooth. I have the Fire HD 8 and it's not nearly as fast or smooth at this tablet. Plus with the Anker Type C PD charger, I've been able to charge this tablet at 16 watts! Fast charging, type c, faster wifi, faster processor, and etc... this tablet is a steal at 149 dollars!
customer_reviews.author: wwjoshdew

customer_reviews.title: Do Not But This Fire
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this!!! 5 of them in 18 months, each one progressively worse. Newest one arrived 10/30. Downloaded my library 4 times in 8 days. The books just vanish off the tablet. Product support useless. Can’t solve the problem can’t understand them. Not an item to be outsourced. I’ve had fire tablets since they first came out, this model s horrible. First one lasted 7 months, next one 5 months, next one 3 months (they sent refurbished without telling me that and it had no warranty), then the next lasted 2 months. Waited 3 weeks for the newest one, it’s lasted 8 DAYS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Received my All-New Fire HD 10 and everything is working fine. Managed to install the Google Play Store and all the apps that were on my old 7th generation Fire HD 10 are up and running again. I'll be further evaluating and update with any issues or bugs should they revel themselves.
customer_reviews.author: *David*

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: 2 things. First pay the extra money so as not to be bombarded by ads every time you turn it on, switch app or it goes to sleep. Second, it says you can use an SD card for your own files. however, its not easy and the normal apps don't work with anything that's not PURCHASED via AMAZON! In my opinion, this device has become an extension of Amazon's marketing department and no longer serves as a pleasure device for customers. This is one of those things you leaving you to wonder what happened to customer service in the retail industry
customer_reviews.author: WoodstockDan

customer_reviews.title: Nothing even comes close at this price point!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! My kids have a few fire 7's to beat around with, but wanted something a bit faster mainly for streaming and browsing. Extremely quick between apps, videos play without any issue, screen looks beautiful compared to past iterations. Most bad reviews so far have been people trying to use incompatible accessories from past fire hd tablets that used micro USB. Fast charging time with 15w adapters and the type C port is a welcome upgrade. Obviously if your not a fan of the amazon ecosystem or OS, then you might want to go with something that runs stock Android or iOS. For the price and these specs, this tablet really can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: WAIT FOR BUG FIXES -- can't download content!
customer_reviews.text: All downloaded content disappears overnight. The speed of download is fast, the display is lovely, it feels light enough for the size, and what an amazing value for the money. But useless unless you have wi-fi since all content you download disappears immediately
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful addition to my Kindle collection
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tablet. White as snow! Setup was a breeze. Pre-ordered on impulse when I found it would be releasing in this color. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to charging dock
customer_reviews.text: Have not set it up. I had bought the charging dock for this new tablet. Guess WHAT it does not CONNECT TO THE CHARGING DOCK.
customer_reviews.author: Bobo

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have had this 2 days.. I have had to download the same books on the 'integrated' Kindle app 4 times since it seems to think I want to remove them every time I switch to a different app. When switching out of the Book app, it doesn't save the book I am reading (it does save the location on the book I am reading) and I have to re-open it every time. Kindle app on iPad and phones works much better. I will be returning the device and not asking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet for the money, fully functioning Amazon and loadable Google Play apps.
customer_reviews.text: Great response time. Seems faster than the 2017 version. Nice blue color. Great to be able to use the newer USB C charging . As usual the set up was very easy. I think the screen is crisp and clear. You can't beat this type of a bargain for a functional full-size tablet. It has plenty of stock apps in the Amazon store... But I used the apk's for the latest generation HD 8 and loaded the Google Play store. Now it is a fully functional all around tablet. Highly recommend..especially for kids and adults for these bargain prices. You won't regret!! Buy Now!
customer_reviews.author: TLWill01

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today love it so far! Bought it for my grandma so she can see the screen, its huge and works perfect for her!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah knight

customer_reviews.title: Don’t pay the extra $15 for no ads, you will still get them
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Fire HD for two days and it seems ok. The reason I’m giving 2 stars is because I paid and extra $15 for no ads and I started receiving them anyway. I ended up spending time figuring out how to turn them off. I am debating sending my tablet back some the $15 extra for no ads was a farce and I would consider it false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Dean S

customer_reviews.title: Lack of control over configuration and bloatware hurt this otherwise good performing tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I am greatly disappointed with this tablet. Not because of performance but lack of control over configuration and available apps from the Appstore. Also preloaded with a lot of junk apps that I cannot remove. Unable to install more secure, privacy enabled browser. Built in Silk Browser isn't even configurable for increased privacy. This is only good for use as an ebook reader and video player for Netflix, Prime and Hulu. It's a shame because display and performance are cancelled out by Amazon centric operating system and preloaded junk. Will be returning and looking for a more consumer friendly tablet.
customer_reviews.author: alex s

customer_reviews.title: No Display Mirroring
customer_reviews.text: I based my purchase of this product on the first HD 10 I owned which had display mirroring. Had I known Mirroring was no longer supported I would never have bought it. It's a lot easier on my eyes to cast to the 60 inch TV to read. Thumbs down. I will be going to an android tablet that will do what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not like the old fire 8"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my fire stopped connecting to wi-fi, I thought this would behave a lot like my fire which I really liked. It is not one finger tap, using from one to 4 fingers and I don't know why they changed that. it is not intuitive like the original fire and it does not want to work with the games I like, not responding to commands with a simple tap and drag like the fire did. it should not be this difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt B. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Books don't stay "saved" on the newest (9th generation) HD10
customer_reviews.text: Books don't stay saved on the device or the SD card. I download them, and within 24 hours they are gone. Amazon tech support acknowledged that this is an issue with the latest version (9th generation) of the HD10. I suspect they'll have a solution in place soon, but until then the device is worthless to me. [Amazon is great about returns, so they sent me a prepaid mailing label so that I can return my new HD10.] I've been really satisfied with other/previous versions of the Fire (HD8, HDX, HD10), so this is a major disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pass. Same old same old.
customer_reviews.text: The USB-C charging and larger SD card capacity are nice, but these are incremental improvements at best. I bought this for video and paid extra for a version without "special offers". However, as soon as I registered the unit, I was bombarded with annoying ads that I could not get rid of. I am returning it and hoping for more substantial improvements next time around. Pass.
customer_reviews.author: J. Richard Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is excellent. You can really tell a difference from the previous version. The processor is also much faster. I also really appreciate the payment plan option. The micro sd card slot only supports up to 512gb so don’t spend a fortune on extra storage. Reading off the screen is very easy with the text sizing adjustment option. I always get the special offers edition. Not only is it cheaper but you can let it keep track of your purchases and offer relevant new content.
customer_reviews.author: Gramuel021

customer_reviews.title: Tablet is fine, Amazon policy stinks.
customer_reviews.text: Tablet is great. Price dropped the day after mine was delivered by $50. Amazon policy doesn't allow for a price adjustment so I have to send it back and re order to receive the cheaper price. Seems like an easy fix on their part to refund the $ and save themselves the processing. Disappointed in Amazon's customer service and policy. Tablet is fine, typical fire.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Warchol

customer_reviews.title: Advertisement hostage
customer_reviews.text: The tablet seems fine, but be aware, you are paying for an ad machine. There are ads on the lockscreen and throughout the device. My kids can't go 5 minutes without asking about the latest ad they saw on my lockscreen. It apparently costs an extra $15 to remove. That is Amazon holding your eyeballs hostage. I refuse to negotiate with such tactics and will be returning. I'd rather spend an extra $500 and get something tried and true.
customer_reviews.author: Arik

customer_reviews.title: Screen froze and has yet to unfreeze after hours of worthless amazon crappy customer service CRAP!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT, NOT WORTH A DIME! Bought it as a gift, gave it to my mother 7/31/20 for birthday, screen froze in September. I have been trying to get my money back or a replacement ever since. Spent 1.5 hours on chats with 4 different people who were worthless, TRYING TO FIX THE SCREEN. JUST TO GET AN EMAIL WITH THE SAME CRAP I did live with the Customer service person. I want a tablet that works or my money back!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Hellman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to disable and make this tablet useless.
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is much faster than our previous Fire HD 10 which is nice. However if you accidentally touch the "show mode" writing at the top of the screen while pulling down from the top to check on wireless, and other operations, the tablet will not operate. On my third to technical support I was told to ask Alexia to turn off the "show mode" to restore the tablet. It shouldn't be that easy to disable the device.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Mike

customer_reviews.title: Bummer...Where's Minecraft and Sound Quality is Subpar
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet when Amazon first advertised around Oct 26th or 27th. If you bought it before Oct 28th, you were supposed to receive Minecraft game (a 6.99 purchase) with it. It is not on the tablet and there are no instructions how to download it for free. I'd rather give the tablet a 2.5 rating than a three...the tablet has nice features but the sound quality is much poorer on this version than other Kindles I have purchased. Even with Bose earphones, the sound is muffled. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Fowler

customer_reviews.title: White tablet,white not black!
customer_reviews.text: Exquisite color.Great sound and fast streaming.Movies are fantastic on this tablet!5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Roxy Drew

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as reviews I've read.
customer_reviews.text: I received my item 31 October (late since I paid for same day shipping). It worked well for 14 days then went to crap. It will only work when connected to previously entered password wifi. No new connections. This means I can use at the house.... Only. Like a desktop computer and not a portable tablet. Once I swipe up and enter my PIN, I have about 2 seconds to enter settings and turn off wifi. Otherwise the screen blinks and locks in 2-4 seconds. Amazon is shipping a replacement. If it is no better than this, I will return for a refund and return to the gods of Apple.
customer_reviews.author: cptoz

customer_reviews.title: Not App Compatible
customer_reviews.text: Tablet was not compatible with any of the apps we wanted to install. We didn’t realize you could only download apps from Amazon only. The main reason we purchased the tablet was to install YouTube TV & Disney Plus so that we could use the tablet as a “TV”. We returned the tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Darby S

customer_reviews.title: Oops!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone seems to like it.....beware..... It took it a day and night for it to upgrade over 800mgs of new data! What's up with that. I called customer service.... Blah blah blah....talked to a woman in India who tried to take over my screen, didn't happen. Said she would call back in a half hour to check with me. Never happened. My books won't download, games downloaded forever. Fast charger. New usb c connection. Not micro... Will have to try to call them again.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi lafitte

customer_reviews.title: Something a Buyer Should Know
customer_reviews.text: You will have to pay $16.33 to disable the pre-installed ads on the device. Other than that the Fire HD 10 is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Themistocles Skoufis

customer_reviews.title: sent it back.. full of ads and amazon crap all the time.
customer_reviews.text: sent it back.. full of ads and amazon crap and always pushing amazon stuff. i have limited internet, so not good for me, i am going back to android unlabeled. (ps it loads the washington compost and you can't get rid of it!)
customer_reviews.author: linda alexander

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have to ask now for 2nd replacement. The software is really bad. Its not syncing. Features are missing. Iam going crazy with this device. The software is bad !! also there is no one at amazon who can help me with my issues.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL PACURAR

customer_reviews.title: Even a 90 year old senior will be able to enjoy this Kindle
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this kindle, I was afraid of it, it had so much more than my older one. After a day or two of living with it and with the help of your tech support, who by the way, was so patient and knowledgeable, I was navigating it like a pro. And yes, I can ask Alexa anything I want. I am an avid reader and this kindle is so easy on the eyes and the greater screen space is wonderful. I was also amazed at the battery life, it is good for a couple of days with out charging. This was a gift from my two best friends, I thank them over and over again !
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth ,N

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with Amazon Recast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet so I could watch sports streamed from my Amazon Recast DVR. After hours and hours of trying to get it to connect to the Recast via the Fire TV app, I am giving up and returning the device. All the troubleshooting and Amazon customer service assistance did not help. My Recast does work well with my Fire TV stick, iPad and iPhone. So the problem seems to be in the device or Fire TV app. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID K

customer_reviews.title: Too much of a good thing
customer_reviews.text: Too big to be portable my previous fire 7 inch fit into a coat pocket even with a protective case. The screen will inexplicably change or drop what ever I may be viewing. Colors and images are sharp and the battery life is good but wish I had purchased an 8 inch version.Hauling this thing around will be like carrying a small laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gen 7 version is far superior to gen9
customer_reviews.text: Not pleased with the generation 9 version. I'm having trouble with the tablet reverting back after a few minutes while reading an article, How you correct this malfunction? Also, I have to go up the the home image to return to the previous page the arrow; circle; and square has disappeared. I'm totally disappointed with this new tablet, I'm happy I didn't send my gen 7 tablet to my granddaughter.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Leon Hagans

customer_reviews.title: sent it back
customer_reviews.text: the home page is full of apps you cant remove could not even seem to be able to move them ads on the lock screen supposedly you can pay to remove those though not paying to have amazon apps and ads in my face all the time they should give them away for free there were so many
customer_reviews.author: edward j stamper

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't support exFat for the micro SD card.
customer_reviews.text: Found a way to bypass the 4GB file limitation for fat32 that the tablet forces on the micro sd card. You must use the micro sd card as internal storage device instead of portable device storage, that will format the sd card as ext4 (linux file system.) That way you can transfer files bigger than 4gb straight through from your pc to your tablet straight into the sd card with the included usb to usb-c cable.
customer_reviews.author: wilbert

customer_reviews.title: back light brightens then dims unexpectedly
customer_reviews.text: I like the larger size. Has anyone else had problems with the light "flickering" while reading? I have only had it a few days so I will add to this as I use it more. Actually, it doesn't flicker it goes bright then dim every few minutes. It is very distracting. Also, I am trying to get this Kindle on the trade in offer . I have my old kindle ready to return but cant find the info on how to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Sudanpa

customer_reviews.title: nice hardware, bad software
customer_reviews.text: the set up was like nothing on any of the videos on youtube or even amazon's written instructions being in totally different order. Example: it refused to allow me to be th only user, but demanded I set up parental controls for an imaginary child. It refuses to allow any print sizes for my books but 1) microscopic or 2) smaller than normal book print. Since I got it as a less expensive e-reader, it is useless to me. I had to go buy a paperwhite .
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No minecraft..as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 Fire10, pre ordered...supposed to come with free minecraft...only sent 1 code..even though I bought 2 tablets and code didn't work in either...says invalid...reached out to customer service...they dont have a clue..asking where did i see the free minecraft promotion....really...i have bought at least 10 of these Fire 10....very disappointed with amazon...guess im not a good enough customer
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: My first non-Apple purchase! I’ve been a die hard Apple user for 10+ years. I bought this because I only used my iPad for watching Netflix and Hulu at lunch, and occasional web browsing or Facebook and needed a new tablet. This is more than I expected and I’ve only had it for 3 days. Also bought an echo dot and love the music capabilities of the 2 items combined. Still won’t give up my iPhone, but this tablet is, so far, more than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Beccue

customer_reviews.title: A broken iPad off of Craigslist is a better tablet than the Fire 10!
customer_reviews.text: Can't add any of my favorite apps or games. Amazon app store has knockoff versions, but they are of crappy quality and low functionality. My 8 year old Apple iPad2, with no updates in 3 years, is better than this piece of crap. The Kindle Fire 10 is only good for going on Amazon to tell people what a colossal waste of money their new tablet is!I I suspect the same engineers programmed the 737's that are falling out of the skies!
customer_reviews.author: Henry Zellman

customer_reviews.title: Came preset in Chinese
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the screen and the plum color. It seems to be working pretty well. My only complaint is that we I first turned it on, it was preset to Chinese and it took me a bit to figure how to set it back to English. Also, I'm having trouble with the promotion code for Minecraft, so I need to contact Amazon, but overall I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey K.

customer_reviews.title: What's Not To Like?!!?
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Fire and I'm so happy with this one too. I still use my Fire HDX 8.9, it won my heart! So. I bought a fire 8 a couple of years ago and it's just too small. I use it once in awhile as a stand by but, this 10 is fantastic!! It's not too big and it certainly isn't too small. Like my HDX, this 10 is super fast, easy to navigate, and for the price of $99.00 it's a steal. Bought one for my husband too and I think he's going to enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: desertflower

customer_reviews.title: Faster than the 2017 tablet
customer_reviews.text: Having "played" with this the past day, one noticeable difference is the speed. Much faster! As for the faster charging with the newer USB C, I'm not so sure. Seems about the same. No biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Alexa go away
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money,I just wanted it for simple things ,like watching a movie, I use my cell phone for everything else. The screen freezes right in the middle of browsing, which is only fixable by restarting the device. And the annoying Alexa...dear God, that pop up would literally pop up every 3mins ,even though I have disabled it ,and set up parental controls to block it . Very frustrating .
customer_reviews.author: whitelotus

customer_reviews.title: SD card format does NOT support greater than 4GB, not compatilbe with HD 2017 cards.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a HD10 2017 edition using an SD card, it is NOT usable in this tablet. The cheap morons at amazon changed the format of the SD card so you can't have files larger than 4GB. This means that movies that you have ripped cannot be copied onto the SD card unless you compress them. The previous HD-10 allowed this and in fact coupled with VLC is an excellent video player. I got this table moved the card over from the old one and could not mount it. The screen flashes an error message for a second, but you are screwed if you want to use your old content.
customer_reviews.author: Just Saying

customer_reviews.title: Vendor lock in, proprietary and apps don't work
customer_reviews.text: The apps are terrible. Most don't work and I suspect Amazon doesn't vet any of them. Don't bother with a stylus because they won't work. The only thing it's good for are reading Kindle books and watching amazon movies. It's too difficult to do anything else and you'll have to navigate through the large amount of broken apps to find what you need. There is no app or access your Google drive. The only browser available is their own silk browser, which nobody supports. There are only a few office suites and file managers, but they cost money and are broken. It's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Orchowski

customer_reviews.title: WARNING...HORRIBLE.....JUNK MAIL CONNECTION....
customer_reviews.text: It's been a month since I received my Fire Tablet and returned it. IT'S BEEN A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!! I'm sure the tablet is OK. But....when I signed up on it gave it my e-mail I WAS IMMEDIATELY PUT ON A JUNK MAIL LIST!!!!! I AM BEING OVERWHELMED BY PORNOGRAPHIC AND ALL OTHER UNNECESSARY CRAP MAIL!!! I have returned the tablet without ever really using it.... Never ever buy a Fire Tablet!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ladyhawk

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift, otherwise I would be returning it. This is my 6th and last kindle. First, the change in the charging cord is very inconvenient. I have cords for home, auto and bedroom that I now have to replace (maybe that was the point of changing it). I could not get all of my apps transferred so I had to do it manually. Some apps such as Pinterest I cannot get at all even after asking for tech support. I will gladly pay the extra money to have a device that is convenient to use. I am not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: Why do I have to have wi-fi on to play the games on the 10". I've already bough or was free on the 8"? Why can't I put my 575 songs on this 10" like I did on my 8" Kindle? If this can't be changed then how do I return the thing? Please advise. UPDATE I tried customer service, got a recording then it said goodby. I RESET IT TO FACTORY SETTING AND RETURNED THE PIECE OF SHIRT (WITHOUT THE 'R').
customer_reviews.author: my opinion

customer_reviews.title: Poor Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd FIRE. My first lasted about 2 1/2 years with extremely heavy usage. I don’t have a TV The picture quality on this is only okay. The previous FIRE was better. But I can live with the this The one thing I find really lacking is the sound quality. The old FIRE surpassed this by leaps and bounds. This isn’t all that great. Wish I could say I loved this. I don’t Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Bon

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Just received this tablet - I was so excited to get it - I was disappointed - it is very heavy and the charging plug was very hot - I unplugged & then replugged and within a minute or was very hot again - then I used a plug I had and very hot also.
customer_reviews.author: JOANNE DIGIACOMO

customer_reviews.title: Needs more work
customer_reviews.text: This fire is a new fire as I understand, but the one I received had several issues so I sent it back and will let them work out the bugs before I order another. But Amazon is great for there return policies and there was no problem at all in that area and will buy again when I can read a few reviews in the 4 and 5 star range. My two stars was given because it looks well constructed but for me the performance was below even one star
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: My 7th generation HD 10 has an erratic microUSB connection due to an excessive force incident. I wanted the USB-C connector in hopes it will not be so fragile. My biggest concern was whether I could still side load the Google Play store to use Chrome, Google Earth, and a dozen things not available in the Amazon Store. After reading others had done it successfully, I placed my order. It worked. The pleasant surprise is the newer version of Android underneath FIRE OS has had a lot of improvements. As a bonus, since it has a different type of CPU chip, RuneScape Mobile runs on it.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Stiening

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - I have loved all Kindle Products since they began
customer_reviews.text: I started with the Kindle when it was just for reading and with no backlight. I still loved it because the storage capacity for books and articles was significant. With all the advances, this is becoming a great all in one device. The storage capacity is even a lot higher. I'm using a 512G SD card because I want all the space it can give me. It's fast, does what I need, and has great clarity on the screen. The battery is really decent. I can use it for a few days before plugging in. Kindles are probably my favorite tablets out there so far. I can't wait to see their next products.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Shumski

customer_reviews.title: You get exactly what's described
customer_reviews.text: Tablet works well, is very fast/responsive, and the display is excellent. Nice, high-res, good brightness. It just works, and you can minimize the special offers/adds to a pretty large extent. I wish data/app migration from old to new devices was alot more straightforward, and in some cases, even possible....but that's more of an Android issue.
customer_reviews.author: snailman153624

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I have an autistic son so we constantly have tablets. I switched from the iPad and starting buying tablets with amazon. I had to re buy this tablet. I couldn’t afford the case right away and yes he dropped it more then once but the texture is like your designed to fail. I had no choice but to rebuy as he needs it and had to buy the case it’s a must with this product. I love amazon but I am really disappointed in this product. Way to slippery
customer_reviews.author: Jahata O Primo

customer_reviews.title: Volume keeps Changing all by itself !
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tablet for the money, however one thing you need to be aware of, and I have seen it in another review is the volume. I listen to podcast a lot. I have different apps for this. However, when listening to a comfortable volume level, the Fire HD 10 will go UP, then Down in volume. In a 30 minute podcast it will happen 2-3 times. This must be a software issue. I wish Amazon would address this, it's very annoying. It keeps me from using it. I have done a reset, update, etc. Nothing helps. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: hth999

customer_reviews.title: Nice but prior versions don’t  last long term
customer_reviews.text: I have every single version of this kindle since the first. Each 200.00 kindle eventually runs out of charging ability. It never fails... I have a graveyard of dead ones to prove it. I love the kindle concept, which is why I keep coming back. Today the screen was cracked when I opened the case. That’s a first! The first kindle was heavier and sturdier. They are now less sturdy. The newest version has a fast processor but is less well made, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody's someone

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT SUPPORT GOOGLE PLAY
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product a 1 star review. Because 1, you can't uninstall apps or delete them off your screen. 2, you have to pay to unsubscribe to adds. 3, and most importantly, IT DOES NOT SUPPORT GOOGLE PLAY. Why did they think this was a good idea. I had to return it because I couldn't download my normal project managing apps. Or any Google affiliates app I needed. So dumb. Outstanding bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Bending

customer_reviews.title: Amazon has done a disservice by their support (or nonsupport) for this item
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with the this Fire 10 tablet the first day I bought it. It would not recognize the SD card. Replaced the SD card that works in my other Fire 10 tablet and the new tablet still did not recognize the SD card. Sent it in to be fixed or replaced. They ended up replacing it with a refurbished one. That one had the same problem, so I am not sure if they just sent my old one back. Contacted Amazon again. Had to talk to a supervisor to get them to send me a "new one". Although the supervisor agreed to send me a "new one" they sent another refurbished tablet.
customer_reviews.author: James Madden

customer_reviews.title: Ads are obtrusive
customer_reviews.text: I have used Kindle Fires for years and have always enjoyed using them. I understand that ads are part of using a Kindle but the ads on my newest Fire are much more obtrusive than on my prior Fires and make Safari almost useless. I will go to another type of tablet next time
customer_reviews.author: Reg C

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment and not worth the deal of $99
customer_reviews.text: I have had a number of Kindles/Fires as I am an avid reader, however I just returned the most recent 10 I purchased since I was having problems with my older 10. When I turned the page, it repeatedly turned back or highlighted words even though I was not touching the screen. In addition, if I was playing a game, the screen was very slow to respond to my touch. It might have been a good deal at $99. but certainly not worth the aggravation and after having spent over an hour on the phone with support. I think we have fixed my original 10.
customer_reviews.author: ccquilter

customer_reviews.title: Great, just not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The Fire HD works well. This is my third one. Love reading. I was disappointed that it came In the 32G instead of the 64G I ordered. I also ordered the plum color and received black. I felt like it was false advertising. This Fire added to my local digital county library make for happy hours.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the new Kindle Fire!
customer_reviews.text: Got this today as my precious Kindle Fire, 5th generation died on me so it was time for an upgrade. This one is by far superior to my previous kindle. Faster load time, longer battery life and more vivid picture quality. What’s not to love?!?! Love reading my books on here and catching up on the latest Netflix show!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy a Fire
customer_reviews.text: Locked down to "what amazon wants you to see and do" to an extreme (and annoying) level. Frustrating!!! it won't even let me add an icon for AMAZON smile shopping to my desktop, trying to force me to use the site with NO charitable donation. No app store entry for Smile either. Won't let you install the Chrome browser or Google docs. Highly annoying!
customer_reviews.author: Falcon NM

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work like my FIRE 8
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to stick with Amazon Fire tablet because I have had several and like that it is easy to set up. However, I was frustrated that the Libby reading app does not work with my new kindle, but did work with my older kindle. I read a lot and this was important for me. I side-loaded the Google Play Store onto the new kindle so I could download the Libby app, but "Libby" keeps freezing up my kindle. Considering sending this tablet back and opting for Samsung instead. Any suggestions out there?
customer_reviews.author: Book Browser

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY THIS TABLET!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely HATE this tablet. It is like driving a car where nothing works!!! The power steering is broken... the air conditioner and heater don’t work. You dread using your car because it is unpredictable. This tablet is like that. Its like dancing with a drunken person. I would have been better off paying more money for a tablet that functions normally. This one SUCKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Issues beware!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift. I can't return it because it is a little over a month. It will not charge though I have only used it about 4 times. It says moisture detected but the tablet has been no where near moisture. I did not like the ads constant from Amazon and the charging cable is less than 2ft so it has to be propped to charge on something to reach outlets.. I only wanted to use it for art reference photos so I really didn't expect too much for the choice.. I would choose a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Aquastone

customer_reviews.title: Performance and Proficiency
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent upgrade or a first buy in this class of tablets. It has a superb screen, fast performance, good memory that is expandable, and has a variety of tools built in, with more available at the app store. Having owned the previous model, and others older, I am impressed and very satisfied with this tablet. In a competitive tablet field, this offers value, performance, a vast potential to make it as you would have it be. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R. K. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Liquid detection issue
customer_reviews.text: We have bought 3 different fire tablets all were great until this last one. A new upgrade apparently detects liquid in the charger port and won't allow you to charge it. Unfortunately our tablet never got wet and obviously can't dry! It has been four days and when I contact Amazon they say to wait longer! This is obviously a software/ hardware issue. they should at least take the tablet and check it but nope just want me to keep waiting! Last time I buy from them
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT buy any fire tablets from Amazon if you want to use WPS Office or Office Suite.
customer_reviews.text: It is a waste of your money! I tried to use WPS Office app, it was not able to perform functions (adding/subtracting) on their speed sheet. The other app Office Suite spread sheet did allow functions to work, I saved spread sheet with data starting on A1 through Y407 after working on it for about 5 hours saving it several times. This morning I tried to open it, I did, but there was very little there. Spotted information (0's) no text at all. Absolutely a worthless tablet. Robert Birks
customer_reviews.author: Robert Birks

customer_reviews.title: Great budget tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet for the price. I got this on Prime Day for $79.99 and I must say at that price there is no better budget devicr. The screen is excellent, battery life is outstanding, I've been using this for several hours throughout the day and haven't had to charge it yet. I've sideloaded the Google play store and have access to all my Android apps which is a plus. The Amazon apps are also convenient to have at hand. All in all a great tablet that I would recommend to anyone looking for a budget device
customer_reviews.author: Mark A

customer_reviews.title: What a pain!!
customer_reviews.text: I have spent two days trying to get this Kindle to work. Impossible! Won't take passwords. I've packed it up already to return. I will keep it a couple days til I calm down then make final decision. The design is awkward. It is too long and the fulcrum makes you drop it constantly. Steve Jobs would never send this design out! Maybe you have to get used to it but it's got a very heavy top and wants to fall out of your hands all the time. Bad design. Don't buy it. Not worth it. At least for me today. Maybe after a few more days. Unsure. mary j.
customer_reviews.author: maryjensen1

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Tablet. Holds charge a long time.
customer_reviews.text: The promotion stated Minecraft was free, you must enter the code at the link UNDER the buy button. I had 1-click set and didn't get to enter the code. After talking with Amazon, they fixed it and I got Minecraft free. The Fire HD 10 is very nice. It has a c-usb charge port which is why upgraded from older Fire. I can still install Google Play and get GMail and GSuite apps such as Docs, Sheets, Slides, Keep. I followed directions I found by searching "Install Google Play on Fire 10" on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT properly display the New York Times. Can't do it!
customer_reviews.text: The reason I wanted a tablet was to be able to read the Sunday New York Times and 7 days a week of the Washington Post. The way the New York Times displays makes it impossible to read... one story at a time, indeed. Totally useless. Inexplicably, the Washington Post displays like a regular newspaper. I DID NOT SEE ONE MENTION OF THIS PROBLEM in all my research. I also have not been able to sync up my local Newspaper either...well, where it's easy to find. What a disappointment! Send it back to Amazon. Guess I'll have to pop for an Ipad....
customer_reviews.author: Steve Higley

customer_reviews.title: For entertainment & games only
customer_reviews.text: 1st time buying tablet. This specific table was a huge mistake for me. I need a tablet for basic work purposes - to be able to access basic email & review files when on the road (Outlook, Chrome, Office365, etc). This device is for entertainment, so none of those are available/supported on this device. The home screen is a mess of icons that you can't remove or rearrange, so it's cluttered with games and entertainment apps. I'm returning because it's not at all what I need. This might be a great tablet to play on but it's not appropriate at all for professional purposes. Writing the review to save someone else in similar situation the time and $.
customer_reviews.author: bibbbidybobbidyboop

customer_reviews.title: Several tablets at this price i have tried, and i'm keeping this one
customer_reviews.text: OK so i wanted a tablet but did not want to spend more than $150 on one since i only use for media consumption and online shopping and magazine reading. I tried Samsung, Digiland, Onn, at this price range and since i got this for $99 (actually $75 by trading my aging HD8) by far this tablet beat them in every way.. looks, performance, battery drain when not in use, screen resolution, and response. oh yeah and i did install google play in 5 minutes. buy this and buy it now. but wait for it to go on sale
customer_reviews.author: Chynonyno

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality of the screen. Buy an iPad!
customer_reviews.text: The colors are always dark. You have to set the brightness of the screen to the maximum level to get closer to what you can get with the basic iPad set at less than medium of the brightness. My iPad 2 which is now 9 years old has a much better display than the Fire tablet. It was big mistake to purchase this tablet. I bit cheaper than iPad but very inferior. For the half of the cost of this tablet still possible to purchase a decent used iPad 100 times better than the Fire tablet.
customer_reviews.author: El Bético de Weymouth

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use Fire Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is easy to use, very light in weight. The battery life last longer than I expected, which is nice for watching tv programs or reading books. Some draw backs on using the kindle, such as downloading apps from other sources such as google, but I can live with that. Wish they had more of a variety of apps available, maybe in the future. The picture quality is very clear and sound quality is very good, like the two speakers gives good background sound when watching tv or movies. I'm still learning all the features, this fire tablet has to offer, but so far I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jean L.

customer_reviews.title: New and improved software!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a HD 10" Fire Tablet for the psst 3 years. I liked it so well that I bought both of my children one last Christmas. A couple of weeks ago I started having trouble charging it. The charging port was becoming worn and when I would plug it in to charge over night the next morning it wouldn't be charged. There wasn't a repair available through Amazon so, I bought another one. When I powered it up I noticed that the software was different from my old one, and a more robust operating system. Although I always download the latest updates the new one has improved firmware. I'm still finding new improvements and an improved tablet.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Cable switch/bait and switch!
customer_reviews.text: The cable connection has been changed. All of your kindle fire cables are worthless. That should have been in bold letters on top of the page describing the new HD 10. This stinks. There are enough different cables for all the electronic devices. Seething!
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Gottschalk

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE, not Google/Apple apps compatible
customer_reviews.text: After 30 days, I would say this tablet was a waste of money. You cannot use most apps, There is constant screen freezes, The design is great, I do enjoy reading books on the tablet. But big downfall because you cannot run Google apps or Apple apps on the device, which if you need it for business that's a big problem. Most entertainment apps are available on their app store though. 90 day review: The silk browser no longer works, most apps are not working, seems like software is not working properly. I've had to reset the tablet twice now and it only works for a couple hours before crashing again and now seems like a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet (9th Gen HD 10)
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life Excellent Screen Decent processor and RAM Expandable storage USB type C Alexa Show Mode, etc $99 on sale Forked Amazon OS based on Android 9 Pie What's not to like? Probably the best bang for your buck in this tablet category. I did my research and checked out the other mfgs 10 inch tablets and not one comes close for this price. Sure, no Google Play Store out of the box, but there are easy peasy work arounds to get that if you want it (and you don't have to "root" your tablet to do it)! So far so great with my HD 10!
customer_reviews.author: nogard

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive tablet!
customer_reviews.text: After using the Fire HD 10 for 5 months or so, I can confidently say that this is a very well-made device! The battery life is outstanding, the screen is clear and sharp, and the OS memory management is exceptional, thereby allowing "desk accessories" running in the background to function smoothly without slowing things down. The speaker could be a lot better, but head phones take care of that quite adequately. Though I wish that it was better integrated with Google Play, I have no trouble accessing most of the apps I need. At a very reasonable price point, I highly recommend the Fire GD 10 tablet!
customer_reviews.author: Garthm

customer_reviews.title: Why no YouTube
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful tablet the mechanics and tech are not the problem with this product. I am firmly in the Amazon ecosystem I have Kindle unlimited, Amazon prime, and a audible subscription but the version of Android that Amazon uses for there fire tablets is so restrictive. You can't download a 2nd web browser you can't get Google apps such as YouTube or Google play movies. I love your products Amazon but you don't have my movie library or a replacement for Google docs or sheets. Until you do or you change your operating system, this is Android don't lock me out of the goodies my other devices have.
customer_reviews.author: Space

customer_reviews.title: My love for Kindle stopped with this one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second kindle fire. My Kindle fire I had since 2012 so I thought I would upgrade. I don't like how the screen freezes and I also do not like the screen quality. I am highly disappointed in this product. Update I jave tried to like this tablet and I still do not
customer_reviews.author: kanisha dunham

customer_reviews.title: Kindle fire
customer_reviews.text: We just took the KINDEL FIRE TO UPS, this morning. The KINDEL FIRE DOES NOT WORK. I CALLED AMAZON FOR HELP. WE DID NOT GET IT SET UP. AMAZON TOLD ME I WOULD HAVE ANOTHER ONE THIS SATURDAY. WE DID NOT GET ANOTHER ONE TO REPLACE THE NON WORKING ONE. I"M NOT HAPPY WITH AMAZON FOR TREATING ME LIKE THIS. IT IS NOT OUR FAULT IT DOES NOT WORK. I was real happy when we opened it up. SAD AND MAD BECAUSE IT THE KINDELFIRE does not work. Sandra Tiner and Lyndel Tiner
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Tiner

customer_reviews.title: Fair for the money but you can do better.
customer_reviews.text: OK for the price but only comes with one access port a USB "C". All my other devices are standard USB or mini USB so I have to buy adapters to use my external drives etc. You cannot use a HDMI adapter with the USB C port and some other adapters cause a wet charging port warning to appear. It also locks you into using ONLY Amazons app store, you cannot access Google play store and every time you open the tablet it presents you with an add to purchase something, most annoying. So over all I am disappointed with my purchase. I recommend you buy a tablet with more than one port and a built in HDMI port.
customer_reviews.author: J Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Working on it....
customer_reviews.text: Got this a day earlier than expected, nice looking tablet, but the game app I most want to play will not open and stay open. Haven't tried downloading a similar app yet, but my mom also purchased one of these at the same time to play the same game and hers does the same thing. Not technologically savvy enough to figure out what's wrong yet. Typing my review on my old IPad. Great price, looks good, still a big disappointment so far, at least for that.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Amazon tablet through QVC. Supposed upgrade to my two previous, smaller Kindle Fires, which I still own. Here's what they don't tell you: a number of the apps I have used and enjoyed on my other tablets "currently are not available for download on the 10" version"! Are you kidding me?! And they will not provide any reason, good or poor, for this. Seriously? I call this a definite DOWNGRADE, and as is becoming the norm with Amazon, poor customer service. For that you get 1 star...
customer_reviews.author: equipage

customer_reviews.title: I love all 3 of my Amazon Fire 10" HD tablets. Audible is my favorite app.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Amazon Fire 10" tablet with Alexa. I have 3 of them now and the newest one has a new/different charging port. But the HD picture is still great, and the sound too. If i'm not using the WiFi, i turn it off, which allows my tablet to charge faster, but also to stay charged for longer. I just turn on the WiFi when i need it. If you have books from Audible or movie's from Amazon Prime already downloaded, you can listen or watch them without using WiFi. The only negative is that you can only use apps that are compatible with the Amazon tablet. You find them in the Amazon app store.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet for $139! You can't beat that price for the specs on this tablet. I love how fast it is and how I can modify it to MY liking - ie remove amazon software and upload Google play store. I'm using it as an Android tablet and it works flawlessly. The picture quality on videos is 1080p quality and the screen is fast and responsive. I wish there was a smaller version with so similar specs. I really wanted an 8 inch tablet but this one is worth the extra money. If you're trying to decide which tablet to get (8 inch vs the 10 inch) get the 10 for sure! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: FL_Prime_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Device does not hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: I use for an e reader, sending and receiving emails, browsing internet. The device is slow to charge, and what charge I am able to get does not last long. I charge all night and get 19 % charge. Tried purchasing new charger, does not matter, now device is dead and cannot reactivate. I will be returning device for repair or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle addict

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is my first tablet, which I purchased at my sister's urging. Sorry to say, but I find that it offers absolutely nothing that I can't do on my laptop and smartphone. Amazon has loaded it up with their own books and games apps that cannot be deleted and their only purpose is to promote Amazon products. I have tried my best to find something useful about this device, but to no avail. I think I will give it to my dog as a chew toy.
customer_reviews.author: Villhelm

customer_reviews.title: Not enough RAM.
customer_reviews.text: Date Purchased: Nov 22, 2019. This Review Date: Jun 6, 2020. Pros: Nice screen quality and uniformity. Little to no back-light bleeding. Good battery life. Speakers are OK. Cons: Not enough RAM. Some apps can crash because of this. Very low headphone volume output. Fire OS. Locked down, very little customization's. No root access for installing an ad-blocker. Too many Ad's. Nice tablet for viewing video content, emails, and web surfing. I would only buy this when there is a discount. I don't think it's worth the regular price.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible device for google apps!  Not for online student use.
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be compatible with my online class apps and e books so I could take my studies with me. Not the case! It’s great for reading and watching Netflix but that isn’t what I needed it for. I mistakenly went off of YouTube videos and ratings and it simply does not work with google apps whatsoever unless you want to jump through hoops that apparently void its warranty. If you’re a student..spend the money on an iPad! I’m returning mine for one after two weeks of struggling. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rounds

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tablet!💕🥰💕
customer_reviews.text: I get so many compliments on this tablet. It rivals an iPad or Samsung tablet but soooo much more affordable. Thank you Amazon for allowing for monthly payments as well. My husband and I have this tablet and just bought this one because I didnt pay attention to the fact that our tablets have ads. It's so nice to not have ads with this one. I love using it to do my Bible study and using it in my ministry to share Bible-based videos. This is a really great tablet and it has expandable memory unlike an iPad. You won't be disappointed with this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy J

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I was using my old Kindle that was about 6 years old...still worked great but thought I would upgrade. I had no idea how far in the dark ages I really was! This is a whole new world...! With an expandable storage the sky's the limit! I was running out of room on my old device with all of my books, I've loaded all my old stuff and will never be able to use up all the space I now have. I love the sound, the speed and the graphics! I don't know how anyone could go wrong with this unit for the price...I'm beside myself in love with this Kindle!!
customer_reviews.author: nightskyTop Contributor: Model Airplanes

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th Kindle fire, my 3rd 10 inch. The last fire was bought less than a Year ago, and I have had so many problems with it, Amazon wants me to delete all my info and send it back in, no, not going to happen. So I bought a brand new one again, piece of crap!!! Its worse than the last one. It is slow, the light dims all by its self, it freezes all the time, the screen will just disappear, or goes on and off. I have turned this one off so many time to get it to work. I have had a lot of kindels, this ninth generation is absolutely junk.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Fleming

product_meta.title: Fire HD 10 Tablet (10.1" 1080p full HD display, 64 GB) – Plum
feature_bullets: 10.1" 1080p full HD display; 32 or 64 GB of internal storage (add up to 512 GB with microSD)
Now 30% faster thanks to the new 2.0 GHz octa-core processor and 2 GB of RAM
Longer battery life—Up to 12 hours of reading, browsing the web, watching video, and listening to music
Hands-free with Alexa, including on/off toggle
2 MP front and rear-facing cameras with 720p HD video recording
Now with USB-C and faster charging.  Includes a USB-C cable & 9W power adapter in the box.
Enjoy millions of movies, TV episodes, songs, books, apps, and games
Picture-in-Picture viewing with Netflix, STARZ, Pinterest, MLB At Bat and more.
